title: The twins who tricked the Maya gods of death - Ilan Stavans

multiple-choice.question: What happened to the twin brothers, Jun and Wuqub, after they disturbed the lords of the underworld with their ballgame?

options.label: A
options.text: They were challenged to a match and won, earning their respect.

options.label: B
options.text: They were trapped and killed by the lords, with Jun's head hung from a tree as a trophy.

options.label: C
options.text: They were forced to flee and live in exile.

options.label: D
options.text: They were turned into statues and left to stand for eternity.

multiple-choice.question: What did the second generation of twins, Junajpu and Ixb'alanke, discover in their grandmother's hiding place?

options.label: B
options.text: A ballgame equipment left behind by their fathers.

options.label: C
options.text: A hidden treasure chest filled with gold.

options.label: D
options.text: A mysterious scroll with ancient prophecies.

multiple-choice.question: What clever trick did Ixb'alanke use to deceive the lords and win the game?

options.label: A
options.text: He replaced the ball with a fake one that looked identical.

options.label: B
options.text: He used a mosquito to sting the lords and reveal their hiding place.

options.label: C
options.text: He carved a squash into the likeness of a head and swapped it with Junajpu's head.

options.label: D
options.text: He used his magical powers to make the ball move on its own.

multiple-choice.question: What was the ultimate goal of the twins in their match against the lords of the underworld?

options.label: A
options.text: To become the rulers of the underworld.

options.label: B
options.text: To gain control over the surface world.

options.label: C
options.text: To defeat the lords and put an end to their suffering of humans.

options.label: D
options.text: To retrieve their father's ballgame equipment.

multiple-choice.question: What was the final trick that the twins performed on the lords, which led to their downfall?

options.label: A
options.text: Ixb'alanke pretended to kill Junajpu, then resurrect him.

options.label: B
options.text: The twins performed a series of complex dance moves.

options.label: C
options.text: They used their magical powers to make the lords dance uncontrollably.

options.label: D
options.text: They challenged the lords to a game of chess and won.

title: The sleep disorder you might not know you have - Alayna Vaughan

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary cause of snoring?

options.label: B
options.text: Anatomical features of the respiratory tract

options.label: C
options.text: Relaxation of the muscles around the respiratory tract

multiple-choice.question: What is the estimated percentage of people who suffer from obstructive sleep apnea without being aware of it?
What is one of the main contributors to obstructive sleep apnea?
What is the primary function of CPAP machines in treating obstructive sleep apnea?

options.label: B
options.text: To deliver a constant stream of pressurized air to keep the airway open

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the recommended behavioral shifts to alleviate obstructive sleep apnea?

options.label: B
options.text: Limiting your alcohol consumption before bed

title: 3 secrets of resilient people - Lucy Hone

multiple-choice.question: What is the main message that the speaker wants to convey about adversity?

options.label: A
options.text: That it's a sign of weakness.

options.label: B
options.text: That it's a sign of strength.

options.label: C
options.text: That it doesn't discriminate and is a part of life.

options.label: D
options.text: That it's something to be feared.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the speaker's 12-year-old daughter who passed away?
What is the first strategy that the speaker shares for building resilience?

options.label: A
options.text: Choosing carefully where to select attention.

options.label: B
options.text: Focusing on the good things in life.

options.label: C
options.text: Getting that suffering is part of life.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the experiment conducted by Martin Seligman and colleagues in 2005?
What is the question that the speaker asks herself to determine whether she is helping or harming herself?

options.label: A
options.text: "Is this helping me or is it harming me?"

title: The secrets of the worldâ€™s most famous symphony - Hanako Sawada

multiple-choice.question: What is notable about the premiere of Ludwig van Beethoven's Symphony Number Five?

options.label: A
options.text: It was held on a warm summer night.

options.label: B
options.text: The orchestra had been under-rehearsed and hastily assembled.

options.label: C
options.text: The symphony was met with complete silence.

options.label: D
options.text: The piece was not well-received by critics.

multiple-choice.question: What style of composition did most composers work within at the time Beethoven composed his Fifth Symphony?
What is the name of the rhythmic motif that serves as the building block for most of the first movement of Beethoven's Fifth Symphony?
What is notable about the instrumentation used in Beethoven's Fifth Symphony?

options.label: A
options.text: It features a traditional classical orchestra.

options.label: B
options.text: It is the first major orchestral composition to use trombones.

options.label: C
options.text: It is the first composition to use a solo instrument.

multiple-choice.question: What is the emotional arc of Beethoven's Fifth Symphony?

options.label: A
options.text: It begins in a triumphant C major and ends in a somber C minor.

options.label: B
options.text: It begins in a somber C minor and ends in a triumphant C major.

options.label: C
options.text: It begins in a neutral key and ends in a neutral key.

options.label: D
options.text: It begins in a C major and ends in a C minor.

title: The simplest math problem no one can solve

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the name of the famous mathematician who said, "Mathematics is not yet ripe enough for such questions" when referring to the Collatz conjecture?

What is the name of the mathematical machine created by John Conway that is a generalization of the Collatz sequence and is turing-complete?
What is the name of the website and app that offers interactive problem-solving experiences and is recommended by the host of the video?

title: What few people know about the program that "saved" America - Meg Jacobs

options.label: A
options.text: One in four Americans was unemployed

options.label: B
options.text: One in five Americans was unemployed

options.label: C
options.text: One in three Americans was unemployed

options.label: D
options.text: One in six Americans was unemployed

options.label: B
options.text: To employ young men in projects like tree planting and irrigation

options.label: D
options.text: To establish an old-age pension system

multiple-choice.question: How did the New Deal's impact vary between Black communities in northern cities and the South?

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: The epic of Gilgamesh, the king who tried to conquer death - Soraya Field Fiorio

multiple-choice.question: In 1849, archaeologists discovered a 4,000-year-old story in the ancient city of Nineveh in northern Iraq. What was the name of this story?
What was the reason for the goddess Ishtar's interest in Gilgamesh?

options.label: A
options.text: She wanted to be his friend

options.label: B
options.text: She wanted to help him with his quest for immortality

options.label: C
options.text: She took a romantic interest in him

options.label: D
options.text: She wanted to punish him for his actions

multiple-choice.question: What was the name of the bartender who gave Gilgamesh directions to cross the Waters of Death and meet the immortal man Utanapishti?
What was the magical plant that grew at the bottom of the ocean and granted eternal youth?
What did Gilgamesh do with his story after he made peace with his mortality?

options.label: B
options.text: He gave them to the gods

options.label: C
options.text: He wrote his story on a lapis lazuli tablet and buried it under the city walls

options.label: D
options.text: He shared it with his friends
